title: Bacterial carboxylase gene detector
description: This feature specifically detects bacterial carboxylase genes, particularly urea carboxylase (uca), acetyl/propionyl-CoA carboxylase, and methylcrotonyl-CoA carboxylase. The feature activates precisely at or adjacent to these genes across taxonomically diverse bacteria. The strong consistency across examples from different phyla (cyanobacteria, proteobacteria, firmicutes) suggests the feature recognizes highly conserved sequence elements associated with these enzymes. Carboxylases play critical roles in carbon metabolism, including CO2 fixation and amino acid degradation pathways. The feature likely identifies conserved catalytic domains or regulatory sequences specific to bacterial carboxylases, enabling accurate detection of these metabolically important enzymes across diverse bacterial genomes.
